sentence.Network_en: Gillespie is well known for his impish sense of humour.

sentence.Network_en: Impish eyes peered from the doorway.
sentence.Network_cn: 门口有双顽皮的眼睛在朝里张望.

sentence.Network_en: Impish and given to easy chuckling, Dan feels most at home when teaching his students one - on - one .
sentence.Network_cn: 但昭义有点顽皮而且习惯轻声发笑, 在 一对一 教导学生时感到最自在不拘.

entry.tran: 似顽童的;顽皮的;调皮的
entry.def: If you describe someone or their behaviour as impish, you mean that they are rather disrespectful or naughty in a playful way.

example.ex: Gillespie is well known for his impish sense of humour.
example.tran: 吉莱斯皮以他精灵搞怪的幽默感而广为人知。
